awd_titl_txt: REU Site: Interdisciplinary Cutting-Edge Research though the Analysis of Global Data
awd_abstract_narration:
A Research Experience for Undergraduates (REU) program at Columbia Univeristy's Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory (LDEO), which is located in Palisades, NY, will host fourteen undergraduate interns for a 10 week summer research experience from 2018-2020. The title of the program is "Interdisciplinary Cutting-Edge Research through the Analysis of Global Data", and the "global data" theme focuses the experience on a data-driven and solutions-oriented approach to scientific research. Students work in LDEO's lively interdisciplinary research and education communities and are individually mentored by at least one of LDEO's 180 PhD-level scientists. The goals of the program are for students to learn through their own experience what research is like, so they can explore research careers; for students to develop self-confidence in their independent research and communication abilities and scientific identities, by their coming to understand cutting-edge issues and contributing to their solution; and for them to form lasting professional relationships with scientists. Research projects are in all areas of the Earth, atmospheric, oceanic and environmental sciences and follow the diverse disciplinary interests of the students. 

Professional development efforts include the three day Cutting Edge Workshop, held at the beginning of the program, which has the goal of teaching students to rapidly assess the purpose, methodology and logic of a scientific paper and to think critically about its importance.  Students also participate in Fire Safety Training, Lab Safety Training and Title IX training, a Computing Orientation workshop, a weekly scientific lecture series, a Research Ethics workshop, a scientific writing workshop and a career workshop. Students will be housed in dormitories at Columbia University in New York City, but they will work at LDEO, traveling to and from via bus each day. Students will also be introduced to the capabilities of the LDEO computing environment, and especially to data analysis, database access and the display of data (e.g. on maps). Most of the funding provides support for student stipends, housing and student travel to attend the program. The program conducts a national search for applicants and seeks to engage students who are from schools with limited research opportunities. This program supports the national goal of developing the next generation of scientists and the scientific workforce.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE TRUSTEES OF COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SITE-Res Exp for Ugrd Site

por.por_cntn:
Project Outcomes

 

            During the summer, our 44 REU funded students from 2018 through 2020 worked with a research mentor or mentors on a cutting edge scientific question in marine, atmospheric or earth science.   A cutting edge science question is one whose answer is important and whose answer is unknown.  The question can be one whose answer will contribute to the general progress of the scientific discipline.  It is also a question whose answer has societal relevance (Table 1).

 

Table 1.   Student REU Research Projects 2018-2020 (Students from Underrepresented Groups only- Asians excluded) and Their Societal Relevance. *Hispanic **Black ***Native American

Student Name

Scientific Question in Accessible Form

Societal Relevance

Mamadou Diallo**

Can We See Dust in Hudson River Sediments Derived from the Fall of the Peekskill Meteorite?

Estimating Fluxes of Pollution Over Time in the Hudson River Requires Well-Dated Stratigraphic Markers

Natalia Figueredo*

How Do Particles and Temperature Affect the Growth of Bacteria from Human Sewage?

The Length of Time Bacteria from Sewage Survive in the Hudson River Is Important to Swimmers and Boaters

Darian Fried-Fernandez*

How Much Pollution is Deposited on Land from Abnormally High Tides?

As Sea-level Rises, Marine Flooding will Increase, Potentially  Increasing the Pollution of Soil and Groundwater

Juan Jaramillo*

How Well Can Sensors of Atmospheric Particulates Be Calibrated?

Outdoor Air Pollution Has Adverse Effects on Human Health and Longevity

Connor Sauceda*

How Will Blooms of a Marine Organism Be Affected by Increasing Atmospheric CO2:How Much Seawater Will Lose Its Oxygen as a Result?

How Will Fisheries Be Affected by Blooms of Newly Abundant Marine Organisms?

Jasmine Vera*

How Can We Best Measure the Outdoor Air Pollution Experienced by Individuals?

Outdoor Air Pollution Has Adverse Effects on Human Health and Longevity

Stephanie Arevalo*

What are the Concentrations of Metals in the Bottom Mud of Long Island Sound?

High Metal Concentrations in Marine Mud Can Affect Burrowing and Near Bottom Organisms- Humans Eat Some of Them

Mariela Carrera*

What Happens to Microplastics When They Enter the Ocean?

Microplastics from Fabrics and Other Products Are Entering the Ocean and Damaging the Food Chain

Miah Cohall**

Did Icebergs Cause the Most Dramatic Climate Changes of the Last Ice Age?

Icebergs May Become More Abundant as the Climate Warms-They Are a Hazard to Shipping

Camilo Florez*

How Well Do Profilers Based on the Doppler Effect Measure the Speeds of Ocean Currents?

Development of Better Scientific Equipment is Important for National Security and Science in General

Stefanie Moncayo*

How Can Data from Black Carbon Sensors Be Corrected for  Changing Temperature and Humidity?

Black Carbon in the Atmosphere Affects the Rate of Global Warming as Well as Human Health

Emily Mustelier*

Can We Determine if There is Lava Deep Beneath Southeastern North America?

Continental Areas Underlain by Lava Are Candidates for Renewable Energy Extraction Via Geothermal Power Plants

Abderahim Salhi**

How Can We Determine the Sources of Black Carbon in the Air?

Black Carbon in the Atmosphere Affects the Rate of Global Warming and Human Health

Desirae Thorne*

How Often and Under What Conditions Do Pelagic Foraminifera Enter the Hudson River Near Manhattan?

The Hudson River Near Mid-Town Manhattan Has Experienced Significant Incursions of Sea Water-This May Be a Marker for Coastal Flooding

Justin Baez*

What Conditions Have Produced Mass Extinctions in the Geological Past?

What Conditions Could Produce Mass Extinctions in Our Future?

Clarene Davis***

How Can We Predict the Best Locations for Potable Water in the Navajo Nation?

The Navajo Nation Has Serious Problems with Water Quality and Abundance

Savannah Ferretti*

How Did Methane Emission Change in New York City During the Covid 19 Shutdown?

Methane is a Greenhouse Gas - It is Much More Effective than CO2 at Producing Global Warming

Emma Michelini*

How Often Do Extraterrestrial Impacts Occur and What are Their Effects?

Extraterrestrial Impacts, if Large Enough, Are Hazardous to People

Samuel Ofori**

How Can We Use Seismic Data to Estimate the Temperature and Composition of the Earth?

Seismic Tomography Uses the Same Mathematics as Medical Imaging

Isaiah Quattlebaum**

How Are Sea Level Rise and Glacial Melting Affecting Greenland and Alaska?

Sea Level is Falling In Greenland, but Rising in Alaska.  The Differences Are Important to Coastal Dwellers

Bridget Vasquez*

How Has Climate Change Affected the As Content of Rice in SE Asia?

Climate Change Affects the As Content of Rice- High As Causes Cancer

Owen Yazzie***

How Can We Learn About Past Climates By Looking at Iron Oxides?

Climate Affects the Dominant Form of Iron Deposited in Sediments and also Affects the Amount of Heavy Metals in Associated Aquifers

 


Last Modified: 07/23/2021
Modified by: Dallas Abbott
